Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for friday, august 15th. in a significant move, amazon has announced plans to invest $4 billion in ai developer anthropic, escalating its competition with microsoft and google in the field of artificial intelligence. the investment underscores amazon's ambition to integrate advanced ai capabilities into its suite of services, enhancing everything from e-commerce to cloud computing.

google has unveiled its latest iteration of ai language models, designed to power more seamless translations and comprehension capabilities. the company claims these enhancements will significantly improve user experience across its vast ecosystem of products, including search, google assistant, and youtube. the announcement highlights google's commitment to lead the charge in ai-driven innovation.

meanwhile, nvidia reported a substantial increase in its quarterly revenue, largely driven by its gpus' soaring demand from ai researchers and data centers. the company's strong performance underscores the critical role nvidia plays in the burgeoning ai industry and its importance to advancements in machine learning and deep learning technologies.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow for more updates on the world of tech
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for friday, august 15th. let's dive into the top stories.

amazon is making waves in the ai arena with a bold move. the tech giant has announced a massive $4 billion investment in ai developer anthropic. this strategic move is seen as a direct challenge to competitors like microsoft and google in the rapidly evolving field of artificial intelligence. the investment highlights amazon's dedication to embedding cutting-edge ai capabilities into its array of services, from e-commerce to cloud computing.

over at google, the company has rolled out its latest ai language models. the enhancements promise more seamless translations and improved comprehension capabilities. these advancements are set to enrich user experiences across google's vast product ecosystem, including search, google assistant, and youtube. this rollout underscores google's continuous drive to spearhead ai-driven innovation.

meanwhile, nvidia is celebrating a significant boost in its quarterly revenue, primarily fueled by the soaring demand for its gpus from ai researchers and data centers. this impressive performance underscores nvidia's pivotal role in the burgeoning ai industry and its contribution to advancements in machine learning and deep learning technologies.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow for more updates on the ever-evolving world of tech
Podcast Title: EP-345 Amazon's Ai Power Play with Anthropic 💰, Google's New Language Models 🌐, Nvidia's Gpu Triumph 📈
Podcast Description:
```html

i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for friday, august 15th. let's dive into the top stories:

  • amazon's $4 billion ai investment: amazon challenges competitors like microsoft and google with a massive investment in ai developer anthropic, aiming to enhance its services from e-commerce to cloud computing.
  • google's ai language models update: google unveils enhanced ai language models for seamless translations and improved comprehension, enriching user experiences across search, google assistant, and youtube.
  • nvidia's revenue surge: nvidia reports substantial revenue growth, driven by high demand for gpus from ai researchers and data centers, reinforcing its pivotal role in the ai industry.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow for more updates on the ever-evolving world of tech!

```
